pr_title: Add Getter.Keys() with Jaeger Baggage support.

timeline.message: More updates to the Jaeger propagator.

Fix the build.

Ew, Java and your improper type inference...

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @param carrier carrier of propagation fields, such as an http request.
          
          
            
                 * @param carrier The carrier of propagation fields, such as an http request.
timeline.author: jkwatson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -115,6 +116,14 @@
    */
   interface Getter<C> {
 
+    /**
+     * Returns all the keys in the given carrier.
+     *
+     * @param carrier carrier of propagation fields, such as an http request.

timeline.bodyText: I think we've gotten rid of all the @since tags for now; we'll set them all to 1.0 when we're ready to release.
timeline.author: jkwatson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -115,6 +116,14 @@
    */
   interface Getter<C> {
 
+    /**
+     * Returns all the keys in the given carrier.
+     *
+     * @param carrier carrier of propagation fields, such as an http request.
+     * @since 0.10.0

replies.bodyText: Oh, I totally forgot about it. Will do.
replies.author: carlosalberto

timeline.bodyText: not relevant for this PR in particular, but I think we should turn off this warning globally, since it's telling us to use guava, which we don't to do for the API, and won't, ever.
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: might be a little safer/cleaner to just use Context.root() here, so we know that we don't have a pre-polluted context.
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to add empty baggage similar to how we add invalid span?
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: That's a tricky one (I will let @pavolloffay @jpkrohling @yurishkuro  comment), but I'd imagine we wanting to keep whatever Baggage we had before, in case there was no baggage at all.
replies.author: carlosalberto

timeline.bodyText: Since we already checked startsWith I think this can be equals check
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: I'd rather stick to check the length, as it only depends on a numerical comparison.
replies.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText: Ah I meant an equal check on the length - if it starts with it, then the length is guarateed to be at least that length and the < here looks redundant
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: Regex split looks like it could be very slow. Best could be to use indexOf to avoid split array allocation but if too tedious can we at least just split on the single chars?
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Let's do that in a follow-up. This code is ported directly from the Jaeger Propagator, but yes, we could try to optimize things in follow ups (we did the same for OC's TraceContext propagator, for example).
replies.author: carlosalberto

timeline.bodyText: Can you add some test cases with invalid, and with whitespace?
timeline.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: A lighter interface like Iterable or Iterator would also work. Collection must support size().
timeline.author: yurishkuro
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -115,6 +116,14 @@
    */
   interface Getter<C> {
 
+    /**
+     * Returns all the keys in the given carrier.
+     *
+     * @param carrier The carrier of propagation fields, such as an http request.
+     * @since 0.10.0
+     */
+    Collection<String> keys(C carrier);

replies.bodyText: Fair enough. Will update to go the iterable way.
replies.author: carlosalberto

timeline.bodyText: Jaeger SDKs would combine baggage from uberctx-{key} and jaeger-baggage headers, you're overriding it instead.
timeline.author: yurishkuro

replies.bodyText: Actually they are getting merged, i.e. see this test - let me know otherwise :)
replies.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText: L225 replaces the builder, so they are only merged if jaeger-baggage header is first in the list, as it is in the unit test, moving this header to the end of the list will ignore uberctx entries, as far as I can tell.
replies.author: yurishkuro

replies.bodyText: Verified that it works correctly by putting HEADER at the end (of the Map), i.e. L225 takes any existing builder and uses it if already exists.
replies.author: carlosalberto

timeline.message: Add a test case for input with spaces.
